availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Reuben F. Scott (Madison County, Kentucky, farmer and )

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Susan Scott. Resident of Madison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Farmer in Madison County in 1860. Household eight enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant from September 22, 1862 to July 12, 1865. Captured in Monroe County, Tennessee, on October 20, 1863. Prisoner of war in Richmond, Virginia from November 1, 1863 to May 7, 1864. Prisoner of war in Macon, Georgia from May 7, 1864 to March 1, 1865.

ab.bibl:
